author: Jaykul
body:
For the sake of argument, I don't really care if it handles it by _stripping escape sequences_ or by processing color ... but it needs to not show the text of the escape sequence.

Use case: we can now put ANSI sequences in format files to, for instance, color files by extension -- but the result is that Out-GridView shows things like this:

```
Mode  	LastWriteTime     	Length	Name
-a----	8/20/2016 1:12:42 AM	5654	[37m.poshhistory[39m	
-a----	4/12/2017 7:04:21 PM	6	[36mdata.csv[39m	
-a----	1/22/2017 4:09:13 PM	1760	[36mDefaultParameterValues.clixml[39m	
-a----	4/12/2017 7:03:51 PM	6	[93mMyModule.psm1[39m	
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: There are no plans to update out-gridview as it only ships with Windows PowerShell and the dependency on WPF means it's not cross platform.  The issue is unfortunate but isn't critical enough to fix in 5.x

comments.body:

comments.author: Jaykul
comments.body:
No @MaximoTrinidad you misunderstand: **_Windows_ PowerShell is finished**.

If they won't take it as a feature request here, they won't take it anywhere.

Basically, if you read between the lines of that @SteveL-MSFT wrote: don't bother filing bugs or suggestions that only affect Windows PowerShell, unless they are show stoppers (which is probably a very hard mark to meet at this point). 

Outside of "critical" bugs, only things which apply to PowerShell **Core** can be worked on.

title: Out-GridView (and ISE?) should ... handle ... ANSI escape sequences.
